text: Hi, is there a way that we can filter the rows returned by a column value? Example: select * from announcements where location_id = number?
<@U3T21PDBK> If you didn't figure this out. I also had the issue, and found that you can add "?raw" behind the graphql import, and it will import it just fine.. Just like "?island".
you can use graphql with those filters or hubl `hubdb_table_rows()` inside hublDataTemplate

Hi everyone,

Has there been an evolution of the Storybook integration allowing perhaps use of plugins / custom configurations?
Otherwise I find it hard to use the standard SB implementation and instead use my own custom one—it's just a default SB install at the root level and it works.

The feedback is, I'm not seeing a major benefit in HubSpot's implementation as of now.

Maybe I'm missing something?

Thank you!

Also, it's still not clear from the docs that <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/js-modules.html#hubldatatemplate|hublDataTemplate> can reference the React module fields within the template literal. There's only one small line of code showing this functionality in this variable `{% set blogId = module.blog_field %}` but it is not explained, it doesn't feel to me like it can actually access the field that I set up in React, although it can. Bit of a UX issue in my opinion.
One capability is running islands in Storybook. For regular React components running Storybook separately is fine.
When I need to modify dev server's Storybook behavior I'm creating custom vite plugins, like adding global styles or fonts.

`Any valid HubL may go into this template, including but not limited to: HubL [functions](<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions>), [filters](<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters>), and referencing any field values on your module (via the standard HubL syntax for accessing module field values: e.g., `<http://module.my|module.my>_field`).`

Is this clear? Anything you would like to further add?
is there any way to see which templates are using a module? (like in design manager with regular modules)
Tiny update: team agrees `aspect_ratio: 'square' | 'large-square' | 'tall' | 'wide'` is the more reasonable way to go.

Also agreed! I was totally misremembering how the choice field works last night. Sorry about that. I’ll try to include that change in the next dev-server update, which should also include support for custom components
That would be fantastic!
<@UAYBXDG4U> Is it possible to view row data instead of “listing” data yet?
In the dev server specifically?
yes
I don't believe so - let me confirm.
<@U3T21PDBK>, you use the dev server?

hi <@U3T21PDBK>, just an update with my inquiry, is it possible to base the rows returned on the announcement field based on the value selected on the location field (see image below)? I will need to use the location_id to filter thru the announcements table.
I also attached screenshots of the table for better context
is there any way to allow a `<br>` in a `TextField`?
testing the `allowNewLine` option..not sure if that'll be similar

Hey, somewhat urgent, I'm getting this error for one of modules but only one one page:
```<!-- An unknown error occurred when attempting to render out JS-rendered `module` with entrypoint `@projects/theme-assets-project/app/components/modules/OpenPositionsJob`. Please try again later or reach out to support. -->```
any idea what this might be? same module on other pages seems to work
can someone from HubSpot please take a look, <@UAYBXDG4U> <@U04DLJH3W94> <@UCY83QS6Q> (it appears to be a cached error issue again and I have no way of fixing that I don't think)
going to try to "update" the template page
Which page?
I'll message it to you, one sec
that seems to have worked but it's unclear why that might happen. No changes were made and it was only on one specific page
This morning, I started using the `URLField` & noticed that it somehow types as `never` in storybook, instead of string, or something useable.
Simplification of code:
Hmm is this Storybook specific or does the `fieldValues` cards.socialHref value also infer as `never` for you?

storybook errors explicitly & is what made me first aware.
but yes, cards.socialHref does also `socialHref: never`
Sorry, I meant `cards[0].socialHref` (since it’s a repeater), but I’m not seeing that on my machine even if I directly copy the type in your snippet :thinking_face:
Yup.

Oh, this is the same bug that <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1715697629571829?thread_ts=1715679224.680849&cid=C04AY1H2204|was found here>. I didnt realize I was running the fix locally so wasn’t seeing this issue. Sorry about that! I will make sure we get the dev-server out either tomorrow or Friday so we can fix this bug.

Oooh, I saw that one & didn’t connect the dots at all.
Thank you yet again being awesome

Hi, is it possible to base the rows returned on the announcement field based on the value selected on the location field (see image below)? I will need to use the location_id to filter thru the announcements table.
